medical_history.chief_complaint: Sudden onset right lower quadrant pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient was in her usual state of health until 1 am last night when she awoke with sharp pain in her epigastric area that escalated in severity. The pain migrated from the LLQ to the RLQ by 8 am. She was unable to sleep due to the pain. The pain escalates upon movement or palpation and was exacerbated during the car ride to the ED with bumps on the road. Currently, she is in no pain at rest. She has been able to pass flatus and has had 2 bowel movements since the onset of pain. No nausea, vomiting, fever, or chills reported.
